Moreover, <quote>Rule2 is preferred over Rule4</quote>, creating uncertainty about whether the gorilla will pay $$$ to the dolphin. These unresolved conditions mean we cannot conclusively determine whether the dolphin reveals a secret to the ostrich.
</argument>

transcript.name: Debater B
transcript.response:
<thinking>

   a) Coyote takes over the emperor of the dolphin

   - Coyote is in Colombia (South America), which triggers Rule1: "if it is in South America... then it takes over the emperor of the dolphin"
   - Coyote has a football with 18-inch radius, which might satisfy Rule3's box size condition

3. For the second condition, Rule2 (preferred over Rule4) states that if something brings an oil tank for the seal, it will not pay $$$ to the dolphin
   - The gorilla brings an oil tank for the seal
   - Therefore, the gorilla will NOT pay $$$ to the dolphin

</argument>
